text: hey guys it's sandy welcome back to
cutepolish in today's video we're going
to be talking about dip powder nails dip
powder has been all the rage this year
but the application of it can sometimes
get tricky so julie will be sharing her
tips and tricks today on how to perfect
your dip powder manicure at home hey
it's julie now let's get started with
the video first things first you're
gonna need a dip powder kit there are a
lot of options right now but for this
video i'll be using the kira sky dip kit
because it comes with everything you
need and it's packaged in easy steps one
through five bottles
as you would with any manicure you're
going to want to start with cleaned
groomed nails this means push your
cuticles back follow your nails into
shape and remove any residue from the
nail plate
this particular kit comes with
step-by-step instructions for how to use
the dip powder which i do follow but i
have learned a couple things that
weren't mentioned in the instructions
which i will share with you a little
later
the first step is to apply a thin layer
of bonder this is basically just a
dehydrator and it's going to remove the
excess oils from your nails to make sure
the dip powder adheres properly but
don't panic this is supposed to leave
your nails looking pale and really dried
out step two is to apply the base polish
to three-fourths of your nail then
quickly dip it into the natural colored
dip powder this is going to help
disguise any visible nail line you have
and make the final color more opaque and
even
it doesn't say this in the instructions
but you have to work one nail at a time
because the base dries fairly quickly
and you need to get that powder on while
it's still wet or else it will not stick
at all another thing i don't think the
instructions clearly state is to dip
your finger in at about a 45 degree
angle until it's completely submerged in
the powder and then pull it out tap off
the excess powder and let it dry while
you move on to the next nails tapping
your finger will remove the majority of
the loose powder but there might be
quite a bit still stuck to your nail so
what i like to do is once the base and
first layer powder are dry maybe about
two or three minutes i'll take a big
kabuki brush and dust off the excess
this will keep the layers thin and keep
product from building up on your brushes
now you can grab the colored dip powder
i'll be using this deep red shade that's
funnily named hot chocolate and just
like before apply the base but this time
you can apply it to your entire nail and
then dip it into the colored powder word
of caution these powders are extremely
pigmented so you're gonna get some color
on your skin but it will wash off later
with soap
[Music]
if you see any spots you might have
accidentally missed it's okay to add a
little more of the base then dip it
again here's where i ran into problems
when i first did this if you apply the
base over top of your first coat of
color and there's still loose powder on
the nail it will gunk up on the brush
and the nail and look super lumpy so
that's why i like to let it dry then
dust off the excess and apply a second
coat of base and dip again don't worry
if you have some bald spots like i do
here that's due to the base drying
before it comes into contact with the
powder and second coat will totally
cover it up
[Music]
on my accent nails i decided to use a
gorgeous silvery glitter powder called
sterling and i followed the same steps
as before doing two coats of color
[Music]
after i have all my color powder on i'll
next be dipping into clear powder to add
a barrier to the color so when it's time
to file i don't accidentally file off
the color
[Music]
then after that i'll be moving on to
step three which is seal and protect and
applying a generous layer of that to
each nail one of the biggest benefits to
dip powder is that it dries incredibly
fast so you don't have to worry about
accidentally smudging anything now you
can go ahead and file and buff the nails
i used two different files starting with
a coarser one to remove the bulk then i
switched to a finer grit file to smooth
out the surface and when you're done
filing you can go ahead and wash your
hands with warm soapy water and dry them
thoroughly now we're gonna add one more
layer of the sealant protect but before
it dries wipe it off with a lint-free
wipe this is just gonna remove any
excess debris that might still be on the
nail and get the nail ready for top coat
step four is to apply a layer of the top
coat in quick short strokes and try not
to over manipulate it the instructions
for this kit say to let that dry then go
in with a second coat of the top which i
did do but i wasn't super happy with the
shine so once that completely dried i
did just pop on a layer of plain clear
top coat to make it extra glossy finish
with the nourishing oil to rehydrate
your skin and that's it unlike a gel
manicure dip powder dries hard as a rock
so your nails won't have any flexibility
and will stay super strong and when it's
time to remove follow the surface of the
dip manicure to break the seal then wrap
it as you would to remove a gel manicure
with an acetone soaked cotton ball i
actually made a huge mistake here and
didn't file the dip powder nearly enough
so the acetone didn't soak deep enough
into the layers and when i went to
remove it i made the incredibly amateur
mistake of peeling it off and i actually
tore a piece of my nail fortunately it
was just a corner and it was on my thumb
so i was able to file down the damaged
area but please please please don't peel
it off file down the powder as much as
you can and soak it for at least 30
minutes and if you have an e-file that
will probably work even better it won't
quite dissolve like gel wood but it will
become soft enough that it pulls off
easily when you remove the cotton ball
and foil
if you guys have any tips you'd like to
share go ahead and leave them in the
comments below and if you'd like to
watch more helpful cute polish videos
you can click on these boxes here and
you can click on the circle to subscribe
to cutepolish for a new video every week
and if you'd like to check out my
personal channel you can click on this
little circle here
